str2: Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To conquer, be victorious, overcome, prevail, subdue. From nike; to subdue.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and ballo; to throw all around, i.e. Invest.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
White, bright, brilliant. From luke; white.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To plaster, wash over; I wipe off, wipe out, obliterate. From ek and aleipho; to smear out, i.e. Obliterate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Properly, the inner bark of the papyrus plant, i.e. a sheet or scroll of writing.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From a compound of the base of homou and logos; to assent, i.e. Covenant, acknowledge.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
